item.title: The Forge Quest Guide - How to Complete All Main Quests
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Forge is rapidly becoming one of the most popular Roblox games in no small part due to its brilliant tutorial quest system and gameplay. The Forge is a fascinating mix of different types of games from gacha titles to open-world RPG games to even crafting simulators.

And that is all before bringing up the fact that The Forge offers quests that will task you with engaging in its fast-paced action combat system against hordes of zombies. There is something for everyone in The Forge Roblox, so if you want to check it out, it all starts with the quests you get in it.

Where to Find All Quest NPCs

There are quite a few named NPCs you will meet during your time playing The Forge. Though some characters will immediately appear near your spawn point or the game will direct you to where they are located, that isn’t always the case.

Instead, there are some quest NPCs you will have to find in the world before you are able to take on their missions for special rewards, including XP. You can find the locations for all the quest NPCs that are necessary for The Forge’s missions below:

  • Sensei Moro: To the right of the spawn point by the forge in Stonewake’s Cross. Can also be found by the forge later on in the Forgotten Kingdom
  • Nord: Near the entrance of the main cave in Stonewake’s Cross and right next to Umut the Brave
  • Umut the Brave: Near the entrance to the cave in Stonewake’s Cross next to Nord
  • Tomo the Explorist: Located near the exit out of the initial location of Stonewake’s Cross
  • Line: Found on a cliff to the right of the spawn point in the Forgotten Kingdom
  • Captain Rowan: In the camp near the Ruined Cave in the Forgotten Kingdom
  • Barakkuulf: Head to the Forgotten Kingdom forge near the spawn area right by Sensei Moro’s location there
  • Masked Stranger: Right near the entrance to the Ruined Cave in the Forgotten Kingdom
  • Amber: In the northern part of the Ruined Cave just past a ramp
  • Demon Skal: Head to Amber’s location and go into the Volcanic Depths by jumping into the hole by her to find Skal
  • Goblin King: Near the entrance to the goblin camp area in the Forgotten Kingdom

All The Forge Tutorial Quests

When you first start The Forge in Roblox, there are some tutorial quests you will immediately have access to. You can ignore these if you’d like, but the markers will stay on your screen until you complete them. These tutorial missions also teach you the intricate gameplay systems, so they are worth doing.

Here are all of the tutorial quests you will need to do at the beginning of The Forge and the objectives you’ll need to complete for them:

  • First Pickaxe: Speak with Sensei Moro, equip the Stone Pickaxe, and mine six ore of any kind in the cave
  • Learning to Forge: Use the forge next to Sensei Moro, pick three ore, complete the minigames to forge your first weapon, and then do it again to forge your second
  • Getting Equipped: Open up your inventory, equip a weapon you made, and speak with Marbles nearby to sell the other crafted weapon
  • New Pickaxe!: Go to Miner Fred in the town and buy the Bronze Pickaxe, mine 10 ore of any kind, and then use your crafted weapon to kill a zombie in the cave
  • Preparing for Battle: Head back to the forge and complete the minigames to craft two armor pieces for the first time
  • Forging Under Pressure: Buy the Iron Pickaxe, kill three more zombies, mine 35 ores, and craft three items at the forge
  • Reporting In: Speak with Sensei Moro to get your next quest
  • The First Upgrade: Go to the Enhancer Shop in town and pick any crafted item to enhance three times
  • Runes of Power: Go to the Runemaker Shop in town and pick an item to put a rune on to make it even more powerful
  • End of the Beginning: Speak with Sensei Moro once more
  • Everything Starts Now: Go to the Wizard in town and reach level 10 so you can travel to the Forgotten Kingdom

All The Forge Main Quests and Rewards

Once you reach level 10 and complete the tutorial in The Forge, you will be able to teleport to the Forgotten Kingdom. This is where your true freedom begins. The tutorial is over and it is now up to you to go after whatever objectives or quests you want.

Below, you can find a list of all the main quests you will be able to do after the tutorial in The Forge, including your objective and any potential rewards you can get:

  • Lost Guitar: Find the Bard’s lost guitar. Reward: XP, Unknown Key
  • The Basics of Mining: Eliminate six zombies for Umut the Brave
  • The Basics of Mining: Get five Stone, Cardboardite, and Copper for Nord
  • The Goblin King: Give money to the Goblin King. Rewards: XP, Goblin Cave Key
  • Lost Cat: Find Tomo’s lost cat. Reward: XP, Cat Lover Title
  • Monkey: Find Bananite Ore. Rewards: XP, Gold
  • Cure for Isaac: Give Isaac one Health Potion I. Rewards: XP

There is so much to see and do in Roblox The Forge, so the thrills don’t end with the main quests. You should find out the current codes available in The Forge, so you don’t miss out on any free goodies and the tier list for what items are most worth using.

item.title: The Forge Ore Guide - How to Find All Ore
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

There is so much for players to do in Roblox’s The Forge, and one of the most important gameplay features is collecting all of the different ore types. While a major goal of the game is to use the titular forge to craft weapons for combat and money, you need ore to do that.

Players can get all of the different types of ore in The Forge using your various pickaxes, and some of The Forge codes that are kicking around may be able to help with that. That said, with dozens of ores available in the highly popular Roblox experience, it can be quite confusing where to find all of them. Here is what you need to know about where to find all the ore in The Forge. We've also got a handy The Forge tier list, so you know which ore is best.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Where to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s Cross
  • All Ore - Forgotten Kingdom
  • All Ore - Goblin Cave and Special Locations
    • What to Do With Ore in The Forge

Where to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s Cross

The general idea is you need a pickaxe equipped to be able to mash at the rocks in the various caves and biomes in The Forge. Destroying these different types of rocks will give you the chance to obtain various ores and stones. There are a few additional gemstones and ores that can be found by defeating certain enemies as well.

With well over a dozen different ore for you to find in The Forge with varying locations and rarity types, it can be quite overwhelming. Here are all of the ore locations and how to get them in the initial location of Stonewake’s Cross:

  • Stone (Common Rarity): 1 in 1 chance in Pebbles
  • Sand Stone (Common): 1 in 2 chance in Pebbles and Rocks
  • Copper (Common): 1 in 3 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and Boulders
  • Iron (Common): 1 in 5 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and Boulders
  • Bananite (Common): 1 in 30 chance in Rocks and Boulders
  • Cardboardite (Uncommon): 1 in 31 chance in Rocks and Boulders
  • Tin (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 7 chance in Rocks and Boulders
  • Silver (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 12 chance in Rocks, Boulders, and Basalt Rock
  • Gold (Uncommon): 1 in 16 chance in Boulders and Basalt Rocks
  • Mushroomite (Rare): 1 in 22 chance in Rocks and Boulders
  • Platinum (Rare): 1 in 28 chance in Boulders and Basalt Rocks
  • Aite (Epic): 1 in 44 chance in Boulders
  • Poopite (Epic): 1 in 131 chance in Pebbles, Rocks, and Boulders

All Ore - Forgotten Kingdom

The Forgotten Kingdom is the second area you will be able to visit in The Forge once you reach level 10 and complete the tutorial quests. Here are all of the ores you will be able to find here:

  • Cobalt (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 37 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt Cores
  • Titanium (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 50 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt Cores
  • Lapis Lazuli (Uncommon): Approximately 1 in 73 chance in Basalt Rocks and Basalt Cores
  • Volcanic Rock (Rare): Approximately 1 in 55 chance in Volcanic Rocks
  • Quartz (Rare): Approximately 1 in 90 chance in Basalt Rocks, Basalt Cores, and Basalt Veins
  • Amethyst (Rare): Approximately 1 in 115 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt Veins
  • Topaz (Rare): Approximately 1 in 143 chance in Volcanic Rocks, Basalt Cores, and Basalt Veins
  • Diamond (Rare): Approximately 1 in 192 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt Veins
  • Sapphire (Rare): Approximately 1 in 247 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt Veins
  • Boneite (Rare): Approximately 1 in 222 chance when taking out skeletons
  • Dark Boneite (Rare): Approximately 1 in 555 chance when eliminating elite skeletons
  • Slimite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 247 chance when eliminating slimes
  • Cuprite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 303 chance in Basalt Cores, Basalt Veins, and Volcanic Rocks
  • Obsidian (Epic): Approximately 1 in 333 chance in Volcanic Rocks
  • Emerald (Epic): Approximately 1 in 363 chance in Basalt Cores and Basalt Veins
  • Ruby (Epic): Approximately 1 in 487 chance in Basalt Veins
  • Rivalite (Epic): Approximately 1 in 569 chance in Basalt Veins and Volcanic Rocks
  • Uranium (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 777 chance in Basalt Veins
  • Mythril (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 813 chance in Basalt Veins
  • Eye Ore (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 1333 chance in Basalt Rocks, Basalt Veins, Basalt Cores, and Volcanic Rocks
  • Magmaite (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 3003 chance in Volcanic Rocks
  • Lightite (Legendary): Approximately 1 in 3333 chance in Basalt Veins
  • Fireite (Legendary): Found in Volcanic Rocks
  • Demonite (Mythical): Approximately 1 in 3666 chance in Volcanic Rocks
  • Darkryte (Mythical): Approximately 1 in 6655 chance in Volcanic Rocks

All Ore - Goblin Cave and Special Locations

The Goblin Cave is one of the late-game areas players are able to visit and mine ore in after the Forgotten Kingdom. Here are all of the ores you can get there, plus some special ores:

  • Blue Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chance
  • Orange Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chance
  • Green Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chance
  • Crimson Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chance
  • Purple Crystal (Epic): 1 in 255 chance
  • Rainbow Crystal (Legendary): 1 in 5000 chance
  • Arcane Crystal (Mythical): 1 in 100,000 chance
  • Fichillium (Relic): 1 in 1 chance in Lucky Block Rocks

What to Do With Ore in The Forge

The point of ore isn’t just to gather it for no reason. The point is to take that ore to the titular forge and use it to craft various items. You are able to get weapons and armor by crafting with the ore at these forge locations in Stonewake’s Cross and the Forgotten Kingdom.

Of course, the rarer the ore, the better chances you’ll get a high-quality or even exclusive item. You can then take the items you have crafted using your ore and sell them or even equip them to have better stats to do better against the various enemies in the world. This is why it is vital that you know where to find specific ore, so you are always improving your gear and gaining even more money.

There is so much to see and do in Roblox The Forge beyond the overwhelming number of available ores. You should find out the current codes available in The Forge, so you don’t miss out on any free goodies and the tier list for what items are most worth using.
